reviews.review: As much hate as it gets, I think it's funny how terrible this game can be. The devs don't listen to much of the input people give this game. Overall, it is really fun to play with friends. The community is very toxic, which leads back to people blaming the "unbalanced" feel bsck on the devs. They're very proud of their game. They feel as if they have done a 'pretty good job so far' regardless of what a lot of people think. Sadly, there will never be enough to satisfy anyone. I simply play this game for fun. I dont feel like people should be taking it so seriously. If all the negative reviewers were to just play for fun, and not so competatively, they would feel a lot of relief. Learn to laugh at their mistakes, people. Thank you. PS buy this game, it's definitely worth it.
good

good game

FPS can get the hit boxes and interactions right, with 20+ people in a match, what in the world is the excuse for not getting it right when there is literally 5 people in a match, hit boxes on players are the size of a barn door. The killers seem to just walk through walls and their hits completely ignore the environment. The hits, hit people even when the person is feet away from ever being hit, or behind a wall or around a corner. If you play the game, you basically have to get used to how broken everything is and the Dev's seem more interested in adding content than existing the current bugs.

Solo para pasar los ratos cada tanto.
*Pros: 
-Ms bajo.
-Logros para rato.
-Matchmaking Rapido.
-Habilidades variadas.
-Personaje de otras Franquicias
-Lore de personajes
-Grafica decente

*Contras: 
-Toxicidad (principalmente de supervivientes).
-Hay mapas en lo que siempre estaras en desventaja (Como asesino/superviviente).
-Juego P2W (Se puede obtener todos los personajes pero te llevara bastante tiempo).
-Matchmaking malo (A veces puedes jugar contra novatos y otras con veteranos, que te superan hasta "10 rangos de ventaja").
-El sistema de reportes se siente inutil (no es automatizado) (en las partidas se suele abusar de las mecanicas).
-No hay penalizacion al desconectarse de la partida (Solo se pierden los puntos de sangre de la partida).
-Si juegas como asesino es posible que jueges contra gente que usa "Discord" (Lo cual siempre te pondra en desventaja).
-Algunas habilidades de supervivientes se sienten "OP" (chetadas).

No sé qué pensar de este juego en general. A pesar de las divertidas partidas que he jugado, especialmente con amigos (la mejor manera de aprovechar este juego al máximo), tiene cosas y mecánicas que la hacen uno de los juegos multijugador con peor balanceo que he jugado, por una cosa: 
Es casi imposible ganar como sobrevivientes, la única manera de ganar en este modo es que el jugador que tiene el rol del asesino sea un jugador que no sepa los controles y las mecánicas generales del juego; incluso si se juega con un equipo bien comunicado es muy difícil ganar y justo es el modo de juego más entretenido del juego. A pesar de que evoque el clásico "cliché" de las películas de terror de este estilo es un juego que me cuesta mucho disfrutar si, a fin de cuentas, sé cómo van a acabar las partidas. Los asesinos son demasiado fuertes para lo que son y ciertas habilidades están muy rotas arruinando la partida para los supervivientes.
Al final, a pesar de todo, es un juego divertido para pasar el rato pero esos ratos se fueron acortando a medida que más juego Dead By Daylight debido a las cosas dichas anteriormente

According to all known laws
of aviation,

  
there is no way a bee
should be able to fly.

  
Its wings are too small to get
its fat little body off the ground.

  
The bee, of course, flies anyway

  
because bees don't care
what humans think is impossible.

  
Yellow, black. Yellow, black.
Yellow, black. Yellow, black.

  
Ooh, black and yellow!
Let's shake it up a little.

  
Barry! Breakfast is ready!

  
Ooming!

  
Hang on a second.

  
Hello?

  
- Barry?
- Adam?

  
- Oan you believe this is happening?
- I can't. I'll pick you up.

  
Looking sharp.

  
Use the stairs. Your father
paid good money for those.

  
Sorry. I'm excited.

  
Here's the graduate.
We're very proud of you, son.

  
A perfect report card, all B's.

  
Very proud.

  
Ma! I got a thing going here.

  
- You got lint on your fuzz.
- Ow! That's me!

  
- Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000.
- Bye!

  
Barry, I told you,
stop flying in the house!

  
- Hey, Adam.
- Hey, Barry.

  
- Is that fuzz gel?
- A little. Special day, graduation.

  
Never thought I'd make it.

  
Three days grade school,
three days high school.

  
Those were awkward.

  
Three days college. I'm glad I took
a day and hitchhiked around the hive.

  
You did come back different.

  
- Hi, Barry.
- Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good.

  
- Hear about Frankie?
- Yeah.

  
- You going to the funeral?
- No, I'm not going.

  
Everybody knows,
sting someone, you die.

  
Don't waste it on a squirrel.
Such a hothead.

  
I guess he could have
just gotten out of the way.

  
I love this incorporating
an amusement park into our day.

  
That's why we don't need vacations.

  
Boy, quite a bit of pomp...
under the circumstances.

  
- Well, Adam, today we are men.
- We are!

  
- Bee-men.
- Amen!

  
Hallelujah!

  
Students, faculty, distinguished bees,

  
please welcome Dean Buzzwell.

  
Welcome, New Hive Oity
graduating class of...

  
...9:15.

  
That concludes our ceremonies.

  
And begins your career
at Honex Industries!

  
Will we pick ourjob today?

  
I heard it's just orientation.

  
Heads up! Here we go.

  
Keep your hands and antennas
inside the tram at all times.

  
- Wonder what it'll be like?
- A little scary.

  
Welcome to Honex,
a division of Honesco

  
and a part of the Hexagon Group.

Oh boy where to even begin... The game is constantly crashing, lagging, and has plenty of bugs. It seems that the devs have not even played the game. The balance changes make no sense. If something is OP they make it more OP half the time. It takes them insane amounts of time to fix anything. Simple quality of life and convenience concepts that have been in games for 10+ years are not in this game. For example, they just finally implemented, after what, 2 years? The ability to stay in the party with your friends after the game. Before that you had to Join each others party after every single game. You can't do anything while searching for game, aka look at the store, upgrade your characters, change your perks. You have to just sit there and wait for the queue. Speaking of queue times, they are horrendous. They are 5-10 minutes+ and even then the ranks are extremely 1 sided. The majority of my games the Killer will either be a higher rank than all 4 of the survivors or a lower rank than all 4. I have had dozens of games where I am level 1-5 survivor, my friend (the only reason I play this game) is level 1-5 survivor and our two teammates are 1-10. The killer? Rank 15-20.. (the ranks start off at 20 then you progress to 1). In my opinion this is a terrible game, where the DLC is way too expensive, the level ups/ranks up makes no sense and take forever to get, the community is as toxic as it gets, etc. I could go on and on but I feel like you get my point.

I never make reviews ever but, DBD is honestly a great game. Sure it has it's fair share of bugs, glitches, connection issues but not common. This game can be repetitive if you play the same way everygame but the idea is to avoid that. Yes we all wish there will be more gamemodes but we dont know if this will happen. Just starting off the game is frustrating but addicting. Once you get up to higher level (I am current a Rank 1 Survivor) the game gets alot more fun when you can out think and "loop" the killer. The grinding and time required on this game keeps bringing you back. I do wish there were nerfs and buffs on both sides but for the most part it is all on how you play. And to all P3 nurses out there fuck you.

Je recommande le jeu si vous avez un contrôle excessif et monumental de votre colère et votre frustration.
Je ne vous le recommande pas si vous êtes sanguin. 

Pour faire court, le gameplay a beau être asymétrique, il est excessivement mal équilibré. On passe de tueur impossible à semer a trop facile. À mon sens les "teachable perks" sont une épine dans le pied du jeu et permet d'avoir une banque de skin avec tous les survivants et tueurs exactement pareil (mais ça reste personnel).

Il existe des tueurs qui n'ont même pas besoin de vous chercher, je pense au docteur en premier lieu, les hitbox sont aux fraises et ça peut être gênant quand le tueur vous touche derrière eux ou quand une hachette passe a quelque mètres et vous touche quand même. 

Dans la colonne des positifs il y a les frissons l'adrénaline, la peur et le stress que procure une partie sur ce jeu. Les poursuites sont mémorables et les cartes faites pour équilibrer la zone. Les compétences des tueurs leur donne une identité, et c'est dommage que les survivants n'ai pas une perks non teachable pour eux aussi avoir cette identité. Des deux coté malgré un objectif simple il y a énormément de choses à faire dans la partie. 

Le pire aspect du jeu (car j'aime finir avec le pire) c'est sa communauté, c'est cancer et toxic a souhait chez les survivants et les tueurs
me gusto la forma en que combinaron el juego con el horror y la supervivencia.

Estou com 18horas de jogo. O jogo é massa porém duas coisas são péssimas, 
1) O balanceamento do jogo é horrivel, você cai com um noob ou com um expert no jogo, ou seja, o rank nao funciona. 
2) O jogo da erro toda hora, tenho apenas 18hr de jogo já presenciei mais de 3 avisos de erros diferentes, e acontecem direto sem exageiro ja deve ter dado erro umas 30 vezes. (quase 2 erros por hora).
不建议长期玩
